properties.Title: Tracking of Emissions
properties.UserDescription: This just tracks Air Pollution for the statistics. It is not used in the actual enforcement. It's different cause vehicles do not count into it

Person.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the pollution.

RightNumber.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon>: Amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere this interval (30 seconds) in Parts Per Million.

When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon>: Amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere this interval (30 seconds) in Parts Per Million.

properties.Title: Querying of Personal Air Pollution Debug
properties.UserDescription: citizens can find out info about the emission situation by using the !pollutiondebug commandThe numbers have "Emission Permits" as unit, which is 1/1000th of a PPM. The daily budget of our planet is 475 PPM or 475000 Emission Permits

PeopleToSendTo.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

properties.Title: Preventing Burst Pollution
properties.UserDescription: if the air pollution in the last 15 minutes exceeds 1.31 times the average pollution rate of 19.79 PPM per hour (so 6.5 PPM in 15m), pollution for industrial machines (not for vehicles) is blocked.

properties.Message: pollution shut down due to detected PPM burst

PeopleToSendTo.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the pollution.

properties.Title: Federal Government Currency Exchange Subsidy
properties.UserDescription: The Federal Government agrees to give either a Currency Exchange or the equivalent market value of it in Euro once per citizen or company for the purposes of trading Emission Permits for their personal use.

properties.Title: Adjustment of Priority and Global Priority
properties.UserDescription: First Case: if the citizen used less than 50% of assigned permits on prios higher than 1 (or none at all and their prio is 1), then their priority is halved (if they had no permits assigned, they had priority 0 already so it's not reduced). Also add it to the global priority (don't reset that one)Second Case: if the citizen used more than 100% of assigned permits and their priority is not 8 already, double their priority. Also add their priority (their old one) onto the global priority

properties.Title: Collection and Assignment of Permits
properties.UserDescription: For every citizen:1. record the stat "permitsAssigned" that captures how many permits a citizen receives. Calculation: emissionPriority * (450000 + (450000 - globalEmissionPermitsUsedThisTick in last 24h)/2) / globalEmissionPriority2. tax back all emission permits they had3. give them their new allotment of emission permits (same as permitsAssigned)4. reset the "emissionPermitsUsedThisTick" stat

properties.Title: Prevention of Sale of Used Emission Permits
properties.UserDescription:
Since the emission permits are not subtracted from wealth, citizens could fraud other citizens by selling permits that are no longer valid (ppl complained about tax spam so they aren't taxed).Because of this, it is not permitted to sell permits that are already reserved and used.
If a citizen transfers emission permits and the transfer amount is greater than their wealth in emission permits - emissionPermitsUsedThisTick, the transfer is blocked.

List.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="TransferMoney">Currency Exchange</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="TransferMoney">Currency Exchange</ecoicon>: The reason of the transfer.

properties.Title: Tracking of Air Pollution for the Restriction
properties.UserDescription:
This one actually enforces and restricts air pollution.
If a citizens wealth in permits is greater than the permits used this tick in addition to the pollution of this tick, it is allowed.
If a citizen is priority 4 or lower, and their wealth in permits + 100 is greater than the permits used this tick in addition to the pollution of this tick, it is allowed.
In all other cases, pollution is prevented.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the pollution.
